body:
As far as I know, we're setting the window class appropriately in Alacritty using glutin's `with_class` call:
https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/master/src/window.rs#L343

This will probably need to be fixed in https://github.com/tomaka/glutin.

If you are willing to open an issue on glutin's issue tracker about this functionality, please do. Otherwise I'd go ahead and open one myself.

Note that according to their documentation, setting the window class is only supported in X11:
https://docs.rs/glutin/0.18.0/glutin/os/unix/trait.WindowBuilderExt.html#tymethod.with_class

So this would probably be a new feature request, however I'm not aware if this is a standard Wayland thing or just something Gnome does. So it might be a bit more complicated.

I'll open the issue in glutin - and I'm also just wallowing in the deep end here. I have no idea what Wayland truly uses (dbus? GTK application_id? window classes) to do the running application associations to desktop files.

Hopefully somebody with more GTK and/or Wayland experience can chime in there (or here).

issue.title: Gnome wmclass is null in Wayland

repository.name: glutin
repository.description: A low-level library for OpenGL context creation

issue.body:
I created the following issue in alacritty: https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/1582

In Wayland, the running instance of Alacritty is not associated with the `.desktop` entry.

Is this something relevant to the glutin project?

body: Curiously it also shows up as an unknown/generic application on X11 here (Xfce)

issue.title: Title is set to "Unbekannt" ("Unknown") and there's no icon if started as Wayland client
issue.body:
> Which operating system does the issue occur on?

Archlinux with Gnome Shell 3.30. System is up to date.

> If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?

Wayland.

Picture to visualize everything:
![Screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5047813/49616963-ea961780-f9b2-11e8-9006-4c00449c4707.png)
The picture shows part of the application menu of the Gnome Shell. The first icon is the icon for alacritty if started as Wayland client, the text next to it is its title ("Unbekannt", German for "Unknown"). The icon below shows the correct behaviour (terminal icon as icon, title is "Alacritty") after starting alacritty as XWayland client.

It would be nice if alacritty shows the correct behaviour regardless of X11 or Wayland.

body: Hopefully fixed in #2077, please let me know if this works.

Great, I'll test and reply - do you know if this release also includes the version of glutin that fixes the repeated keypress issue? I recall using a custom fork (with a bumped version of glutin) to enable multiple keypresses.
@sevagh I think this has been solved a while ago, however I'm not certain which key repetition issue you're talking about.

Apologies for vagueness
This is the issue: https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/1257
Looks like it was solved here: https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/1403
Thanks a lot for the feedback! Glad to see it works.
